column5: So I bought a new alumacraft classic tiller boat this spring. I would like to take it to canada fishing. I have only been to flyins. Where would u go as a first timer. Mainly want to chase walleye and would like to go yet this summer.
I would go to Lac Suel Evergreen Lodge. We have a group of 6 guys that go every year for the last 15 years or so. Very nice place and the owners, Pat & Gary, are very cordial.
Bower's Frog Rapids at Sioux Lookout. Access to Abrams, Pelican and Minitaki Lakes. Just a short drive to Lac Suel.

+1 for Frog Rapids. Been there once this year, going again in a couple weeks. Easy access to 3 lakes from the dock, and trailering to Lac Seul if you want even bigger water or more wilderness. The Bowers will treat you right.
Check out Golden Hook Camp on Gullrock. I have been going there 25 years. Golden Hook has very nice docks and slips for your boat. It is a great Walleye lake.
What's your budget? Seeing you just bought a boat..... Love Lac Seul!

I have fished several lakes in ontario and lac seul would be on the top. But u need to think about how far u want to travel every day on where u stay and what time of year u are there. There are some rocks not marked all over that lake. I will be fishing around perrault falls in august and see alot of boats from up by ear falls that time of year.

tddog, checkout http://www.vermilionbaylodge.com/. Excellent facilities, premier customer service, and . . . your new Classic will be docked in a protected area off the main lake so you don't have to worry about the overnight storms and wind. They'll help you get on the 'eyes, too.
